intro: Kallstroemia californica var. brachystylis, commonly known as the short-stemmed California kallstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with short, upright stems and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. This variety is distinguished by its shorter floral stems compared to other varieties of Kallstroemia.
